# Course Overview {.unnumbered}

## What you will learn

- Describe when logistic regression is appropriate for binary and
  categorical outcomes.
- Interpret odds, odds ratios, and predicted probabilities.
- Fit logistic models in R using `glm()` with the binomial family.
- Assess model fit with likelihood-based measures and classification
  diagnostics.
- Communicate results with clear effect summaries and visualizations.

## How to use this book

- Each chapter is a short module with a focused set of concepts and
  practice prompts.
- Code examples use built-in R datasets so you can run them immediately.
- The final module shows a compact end-to-end workflow on a realistic
  classification task.
